newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: ASEAN stand on Cambodia can still change -Manila.
newsitem.headline: ASEAN stand on Cambodia can still change -Manila.

text.p: Philippine Foreign Secretary Domingo Siazon said on Monday ASEAN's decision to admit Cambodia as a member this month can still change depending on the internal situation in that country.
"That decision could still change depending on how bad the situation turns out," he told reporters, referring to recent fighting in the Cambodian capital Phnom Penh.

"If this fighting does not stop, obviously, ASEAN members will have to rethink this seriously...because they may not be capable of dealing with a situation of war inside the country," Siazon said. Under an earlier agreement among Association of South East Asian Nations states, Cambodia was to be formally accepted as a member at a meeting of the seven-nation group this month.

In Kuala Lumpur earlier on Monday, Malaysia's Acting Prime Minister Anwar Ibrahim said the ASEAN position on Cambodia's membership "has not changed because the commitment has already been made." ASEAN, which groups Malaysia, the Philippines, Indonesia, Singapore, Thailand, Brunei and Vietnam, has agreed to simultaneously accept Cambodia, Laos and Burma as new members.
